Validation Plan

aNCA authors

Source: vignettes/validations.Rmd
validations.Rmd

Validations

The current validation methods for aNCA are listed here:

  • Code coverage >90%. You can check this either in our GitHub README badge or by running yourself covr::package_coverage() in our repository (after cloning)
  • CI/CD workflow passing. Testing package installation on Ubuntu (22.04) & Windows (latest), unit function tests and general documentation aspects (completeness, spelling…)
  • Internal company validations. So far, we obtained a successfully validated report from Roche; see the report. The validation methodology can be consulted here, or also here
  • Parameter calculations done using the PKNCA. This R package has already been used for FDA submission, for more details about it click here.

If you feel something is missing or have ideas on how to improve the validation process, we’d love to hear your feedback, check this issue and comment!

Potential new validations

Among our plans will be to:

  • Automate CI/CD CDISC standard testings in the outputs
  • Polish our end-to-end Shiny App tests (there is an ongoing draft)
  • Consider other testing types: fuzzing, chaos, sensibility…
  • Assess risk in our CI/CD using OS tools with metrics based on popular packages created for this
  • Join CRAN to increase the number of users testing the App
  • Improve App documentation (i.e, tutorials) so new users can test all the App options

On this page
